name: The Westin New York Grand Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 1-night stay at the Westin.
reviews.title: Great hotel and good value for money

reviews.text: We booked a deluxe room and ended up on the 36th floor with a view of the Empire State Building. We took the pre-paid option and we thought it was very good value for money compared to other hotels in this caliber. Very comfy beds, good shower (even though bathroom was small), clean and everything was new. The location is just a few minutes walk to Grand Central. Hopefully we will return to NY for a longer stay. We would definitely book the Westin again.
reviews.title: pick your date

reviews.text: I had a one night business trip here. The location is good, and the rooms are fine without being sumptuous. Bathrooms are cramped but everything you need. But the entire hotel was grotesquely overpriced at $500 for the room and another $50 for an indifferent and slow breakfast. I can't imagine they could get away with such prices outside of Central Manhattan, and even then I hope only during the UN General Assembly with which I had the misfortune to coincide.
reviews.title: "A bad apple spoils the bin"

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for 3 days and I knew that this hotel is better than the ones I have stayed in the US in terms of room space. It was surprisingly large but we were disappointed with its cleanliness. The headboard was tainted with handprints which you can only see if you really looked at it with lights on. The frames hanging on the wall was full of dust and the table was not cleaned well. My sister is a housekeeping manager and I have allergy from dust so we both know that there's something wrong in the room. The hotel is very close to grand central, stores, NY public library, and times square. Did not mind the long walk from port authority as the weather was good.
reviews.title: Excellent location + TOPhotel
Good location, smelled pleasant
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights during August 2013, we got a package deal with Arke.nl in Holland. Amazing value for money! This hotel is complete and suits all the very nice Westin Standards you would expect. We stayed on the 21st floor with nice view of 42nd street and the Chrysler Building. The room had a large closet, a "heavenly" bed = HUGE and a small salon with sofa and a table. There was also a minibar and a coffeemaker to make your own Starbucks coffee. Breakfast was not buffetstyle. We actually had breakfast included in the room, so we could take as much and how many dishes we wanted a-la-carte, really good!!! As soon as you step outside the hotel, Grand Central Station is a 5 minute walk and from there, everything is really easy to reach. Go there, you won't be dissappointed!
I just spent 5 nights at this hotel and I was truly impressed by the great quality of customer service - especially for New York!
reviews.title: Great stay in NYC + great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived really early from Los Angeles, and I had previously requested an early check-in which they generally don't guarantee until time of check-in Upon arriving at the front desk, I was graciously greeted by Hoda who was just was as sweet as she can be! She checked me in early, no questions asked! I was so thankful to get into my room early after a sleepless red-eye flight. Thank You HODA! You were the BEST!
reviews.title: Great hotel overall

reviews.text: I had a room with two double beds on the 26th floor facing the Chrysler Building - my all time favorite building in the whole world - and I must say that the size of the room was mind-blowing considering hotel rooms in New York are usually tiny shoe boxes.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.text: The entire staff at the Westin GC was super friendly! Even the service+food at the restaurant was great!
reviews.title: Great location!!!!

reviews.text: Loved my stay! I would definitely book them again for NY! Thank you again HODA for your kind service and friendly personality!
reviews.title: Location and Great Service make this an excellent option.

reviews.text: Had a wonderful near perfect stay.Great room,best beds,warm staff.Two minor complaints,mediocre water pressure in the shower and sometimes a long wait for elevators.Even with these minor imperfections this hotel deserves the best rating.Loved the location.
reviews.title: Great Choice
Great Stay!
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at this hotel while in NYC after considering countless other hotels and reading reviews (we're pretty particular). We couldn't have been happier with our choice. It was in a great central location, just a short walk from Grand Central station with plenty of shops nearby and a decent Italian restaurant across the road. We had requested a room with a view of the Chrysler building and were pleasantly surprised when we checked in late at night to find out our room had been upgraded to the 38th floor. It was a large, clean, modern room with a comfortable bed and a great view of the city. Heaps of bath towels which is very rare when staying at a hotel. It's a busy hotel and the staff ware all very friendly. Free Wi Fi was available in the lobby, so it wasn't a problem to pop down to check emails etc. Definitely would stay here again and would recommend it.

reviews.title: Fantastic Experience!
reviews.text: My recent stay was great! The room was comfortable and the staff friendly. I tried the run program and it turned out to be the best part of my stay. Definitely ask for Joe if you try it. He was a great running parter and super funny too!

We stayed here for a little family getaway. Staff was extremely helpful and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. Great location. Walkable distance to all your major attractions. No complaints whatsoever :)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 2 nights here on a weekend getaway. The location is excellent, one block from the subway and Grand Central Station. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful as was the concierge who told us about the excellent bagels at Zucker's three blocks away. Our nicely decorated room was surprisingly roomy, with a comfortable king bed, loveseat, armchair, desk, and large ottoman. It even had a radio, which we appreciated. The bathroom was large and well-appointed. Free wifi is available in the lobby. (I would have given this hotel a 5-star rating if it provided free in-room wifi.) We'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel Experience

reviews.text: Stayed on a Sunday night. Check-in was courteous. Stayed in a corner room on the 37th floor with a great view of 42nd Street and the Chrysler Building. Bed was very comfortable. Used the fitness center 2 times......it was excellent.
reviews.title: Quality with location

reviews.text: I was here this past Sunday night for a business event on Monday. The business event i was attending had all their meetings here at the hotel, so I decided stay here instead.
reviews.title: Great location, so so hotel

reviews.text: When I got to the hotel, it was around 630p on a Sunday evening. I normally would take taxi from LGA airport, but since I didn't have anything planned for Sunday night, I decided to take the bus to Grand Central, which was just 2 blocks away from hotel. So location wise, this would have been a 5 stars as it was close to just about anything on 42nd street.
reviews.title: Great hotel for your ny stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check in, I was given a room on 10th floor facing the street. As expected, it was loud throughout the whole night. I could hear just about everything. I decided to just drop my stuff and head out to look for dinner. When I got back to the hotel around 9p, noticed the noise from outside was still quite loud. Upon checking the 2 sliding windows, noticed the latch on both them was not latched. Try to move the windows to aligned the latch as they were about 2mm off w/o any success. Even if it was latched, not sure if it would have solve the noise problem as the windows were old, and the window frame looked very basic and cheap (I'm no experts on windows, but recently home renovation, I've seen quite a few demonstration from salesman on what a good window should be, so I have some ideas).
reviews.title: Great stay at GC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room size was sufficient. I had 2 double beds, which I didn't mind as I was just traveling on my own. TV was good, but it was very slow to change from channel to channel. The bathroom and the room were all very clean and neat. The shower however was bit odd as it had 2 positions. One was from the overhead, but it didn't have much pressure. The other one was on a portable, but when it's rested on the stand, it wasn't very good as the water would come out horizontal. Aside from holding it, you can't adjust the angle of it if that makes sense.
reviews.title: Comfortable,clean and convenient

description: The Westin New York Grand Central hotel is located in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Our hotel is ideal for both leisure and business travelers as it is ideally located near Grand Central Terminal.
